title: Concentration Quiz
description: Pay close attention! These tricky questions test your focus, attention to detail, and careful reading skills.

questions.question: A farmer has 17 sheep. All but 9 run away. How many sheep does the farmer have left?
questions.explanation: 'All but 9' means 9 remain. It's easy to instinctively subtract 9 from 17, but read carefully!

questions.question: How many months in a year have 28 days?
questions.explanation: All 12 months have at least 28 days! The question doesn't ask which months have exactly 28 days.

questions.question: If you're running a race and you pass the person in 2nd place, what place are you in now?
questions.explanation: If you pass the person in 2nd place, you take their position — so you're now in 2nd place, not 1st.

questions.question: A doctor gives you 3 pills and tells you to take one every 30 minutes. How many minutes will it take to finish all the pills?
questions.explanation: You take the first pill immediately (0 min), the second at 30 minutes, and the third at 60 minutes. Total: 60 minutes.

questions.question: Which is heavier: a pound of feathers or a pound of gold?
questions.explanation: A pound is a pound! Both weigh exactly one pound, regardless of the material.

questions.question: If there are 6 apples in a basket and you take away 4, how many apples do YOU have?
questions.explanation: You took 4 apples, so you have 4. The question asks how many you have, not how many are left in the basket.

questions.question: Some months have 30 days, some have 31 days. How many months have exactly 30 days?
questions.explanation: Exactly 4 months have 30 days: April, June, September, and November.

questions.question: Is it legal for a man to marry his widow's sister?
questions.explanation: If a man has a widow, that means he has passed away. A deceased person cannot marry anyone!

questions.question: Before Mount Everest was discovered, what was the tallest mountain in the world?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest was still the tallest mountain — it just hadn't been discovered yet! The discovery didn't change the mountain's height.

questions.question: What word is spelled incorrectly in every dictionary?
questions.explanation: The word 'incorrectly' is always spelled I-N-C-O-R-R-E-C-T-L-Y — which is, by definition, 'incorrectly'!

questions.question: If a red house is made of red bricks and a blue house is made of blue bricks, what is a greenhouse made of?
questions.explanation: A greenhouse is made of glass! It's not actually green — it's a structure for growing plants.

questions.question: Two fathers and two sons go fishing. Each catches one fish. They bring home exactly 3 fish. How is that possible?
options: One is grandfather, father, and son
questions.explanation: There are only 3 people: a grandfather, his son (who is also a father), and his grandson. Two fathers + two sons = 3 people.

questions.question: How many times can you subtract 5 from 25?
questions.explanation: Only once! After you subtract 5 from 25 the first time, you have 20 — and you're no longer subtracting from 25.

questions.question: Which weighs more: 100 pounds of rocks or 100 pounds of cotton?
options: Depends on the type of rock
questions.explanation: 100 pounds is 100 pounds, regardless of what material it is. They weigh exactly the same!

questions.question: If you have a bowl with six oranges and you take away two, how many oranges do you have?
questions.explanation: You took two oranges, so you have two oranges. The bowl still has four, but you have two.

questions.question: What gets wetter the more it dries?
questions.explanation: A towel gets wetter as it dries other things. The more you use it to dry, the wetter it becomes!

questions.question: A plane crashes exactly on the border of the United States and Canada. Where do they bury the survivors?
questions.explanation: You don't bury survivors — they're still alive! The question is designed to make you focus on the border detail.

questions.question: If it takes 5 machines 5 minutes to make 5 widgets, how many minutes does it take 100 machines to make 100 widgets?
questions.explanation: Each machine makes one widget in 5 minutes. So 100 machines working simultaneously would make 100 widgets in 5 minutes.

questions.question: How many animals of each kind did Moses take on the Ark?
questions.explanation: It was Noah who built the Ark, not Moses! This is a classic attention trick — many people answer '2' without catching the name swap.

questions.question: A clerk at a butcher shop stands five feet ten inches tall and wears size 13 sneakers. What does he weigh?
questions.explanation: He works at a butcher shop — he weighs meat! The question is about what he weighs (as in his job), not how much he weighs.
